body:
$FB Apple Inc $AAPL is taking a different approach from other companies such as Facebook parent Meta Platforms Inc $FB with respect to Metaverse — an immersive virtual world. 
What Happened: Apple’s virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) headsets are meant to send users on short sojourns to the virtual world and are not intended for venturing into the Metaverse, according to sources of technology journalist Mark Gurman’s “Power On” newsletter, reported Apple Insider. 
"I've been told pretty directly that the idea of a completely virtual world where users can escape to — like they can in Meta Platforms/Facebook's vision of the future — is off limits from Apple," wrote Gurman, according to Apple Insider.

$AAPL  $TSLA  $AMTD  Before I spend a say on hold, can anyone tell me why I had to sell $19,000 of stocks to cover $6,000 margin call? I sold $6,000 originally and it went to $4,000. so I sold another $5,000 and it went to $2,000. sold another $3,600 and it went to $1,200. Sold another $3,600 and it’s finally gone now. Wtf!?!?

$AAPL Simply hilarious reading how certain funds just invested and bought 1000 shares, 1500 shares etc., and the average day trader buys 2000, 3000, 4000 shares and we don’t see that article written. $APPL to $500 is my guess once they iCar makes it’s announcement.
